title: College Enrollment Rebounds to Pre-Pandemic Levels for First Time
introText: College enrollment has finally recovered to pre-pandemic levels after years of decline. Community colleges show the strongest growth as students seek affordable pathways to degrees and workforce credentials.

content.content: Fall 2025 enrollment reached 19.5 million students, matching 2019 pre-pandemic levels. Community college enrollment led the rebound with 8% growth, while four-year universities saw modest 3% increases.
Free community college programs in 20 states have driven enrollment. Employer demand for credentials and improved job placement data have convinced skeptical students that college remains worthwhile.
Adult learners over 25 represent the fastest-growing segment, seeking new skills for career changes. International student enrollment has also fully recovered.
